questions.question: Answer any FIVE of the following questions in two to three sentences each:
subparts: (i) What chores did our Holy Prophet (S.A.W.) use to do?
(ii) On what condition did the Caliph decide to forgive the beggar?
(iii) How is social media assisting students and professionals in their respective fields?

questions.question: Do as directed: (as instructed in the bracket)

questions.question: Translate the following paragraph into Urdu or Sindhi: Life in the city is full of activity. Early in the morning hundreds of people rush out of their homes. Soon the streets are full of traffic. Shops and offices open, students flock to their school, colleges and universities and the day's work begin. Hundreds of people visit many places of interest of the city.

Write an essay on any one of the following topics: (10) (i) Parental Role in Education (ii) A Heart Wrenching Accident (iii) An Interesting Cricket Match –OR–, Suppose you are the Headmaster/Headmistress of your school. What steps will you take to improve the quality of education and how will you multiply the present strength of students? Write in detail your plan of action.
Write a letter to your younger brother; advising him to work hard to achieve his goal of life. (10) –OR–, Write a letter to the editor of a newspaper about the insanitary conditions of your locality.

Read the following passage and answer the questions given below: (15) After Asia, Africa is the largest continent and it consists of more than thirty-five independent countries. Its northern parts have relations with Europe and Asia for many centuries but, very little was known about other parts till the middle of the last century. No wonder it was called the "Dark Continent" once. Nigeria is the large country of West Africa and it is the most thickly populated of all the African countries. One thing that is common in our villages and which we shall miss in an African village is the cattle. In many parts of Africa, farmers cannot rear cattle on account of a kind of fly whose sting kills the cattle and causes sleeping sickness among human beings. In the absence of cattle, the farmer has to plough the fields with his hands, carry load to market and walk long distances. He may, however, keep a goat for milk, and poultry for eggs.
subparts: (i) What do you know about continent Africa? (2)
(ii) What do African farmers miss in their villages and what do they do in the absence of it? (2)
(iii) Why was Africa once called 'Dark Continent'? (2)
(iv) Make a summary of the above passage with a suitable title. (5)
(v) Find a word from the above passage that means: (4) sort, one hundred, surprise, connection
